content: The British government formally recognized the Soviet Union and began diplomatic relations with [Robert M. Hodgson](/wiki/Robert_Hodgson_(diplomat) "Robert Hodgson (diplomat)") as the first [chargé d'affaires](/wiki/Charg%C3%A9_d%27affaires "Chargé d'affaires").
sources: ["Britain Recognizes Soviet Government Without Conditions; Formal Relations Are Resumed, With R.M. Hodgson as Charge d'Affaires"](https://www.nytimes.com/1924/02/02/archives/britain-recognizes-soviet-government-without-conditions-formal.html). *[The New York Times](/wiki/The_New_York_Times "The New York Times")*. February 2, 1924. p. 1.

Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. [London](/wiki/London "London"): Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 315. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: Honduran President [Rafael López Gutiérrez](/wiki/Rafael_L%C3%B3pez_Guti%C3%A9rrez "Rafael López Gutiérrez"), who had been [elected in 1919](/wiki/1919_Honduran_general_election "1919 Honduran general election") for a 4-year term that started on February 1, 1920, refused to leave office after his term expired, citing the failure of the Honduran Congress to elect a president following the lack of any candidate to receive a majority in the [1923 presidential election](/wiki/1923_Honduran_general_election "1923 Honduran general election").
sources: "Honduras May be on Brink of Civil Warfare". *[Los Angeles Times](/wiki/Los_Angeles_Times "Los Angeles Times")*. February 2, 1924. p. 5.
"War of Three Sides Begins in Honduras; Two Candidates for Presidency Take Up Arms While President Becomes Dictator". *The New York Times*. February 3, 1924. p. 19.

["Chronology 1924"](https://web.archive.org/web/20200402163020/http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1924.htm). *[indiana.edu](/wiki/Indiana.edu "Indiana.edu")*. 2002. Archived from [the original](http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1924.htm) on April 2, 2020. Retrieved January 16, 2015.

content:
**Born:**
	* [Richard Hooker](/wiki/Richard_Hooker_(author) "Richard Hooker (author)") (pen name for Dr. Hiester Richard Hornberger Jr.), American surgeon and author who wrote a novel based on his experiences at a [mobile army surgical hospital](/wiki/Mobile_Army_Surgical_Hospital "Mobile Army Surgical Hospital") during the Korean War, *MASH: A Novel About Three Army Doctors* (published 1968), later adapted into [a successful film](/wiki/M*A*S*H_(film) "M*A*S*H (film)") in 1970 and an even more successful TV series in 1972, [M\*A\*S\*H](/wiki/M*A*S*H_(TV_series) "M*A*S*H (TV series)")*; in [Trenton, New Jersey](/wiki/Trenton,_New_Jersey "Trenton, New Jersey") (d. 1997)*
	* [Ruth Teitelbaum](/wiki/Ruth_Teitelbaum "Ruth Teitelbaum"), American computer programmer who was one of six women assigned to enter data into the U.S. Army's Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer ([ENIAC](/wiki/ENIAC "ENIAC")); as Ruth Lichterman in [the Bronx](/wiki/The_Bronx "The Bronx") (d.1986)
sources: Mifflin, Lawrie (November 7, 1997). ["H. Richard Hornberger, 73, Surgeon Behind 'M\*A\*S\*H'"](https://www.nytimes.com/1997/11/07/arts/h-richard-hornberger-73-surgeon-behind-m-a-s-h.html). *The New York Times*.

content: [Ruth Teitelbaum](/wiki/Ruth_Teitelbaum "Ruth Teitelbaum"), American computer programmer who was one of six women assigned to enter data into the U.S. Army's Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer ([ENIAC](/wiki/ENIAC "ENIAC")); as Ruth Lichterman in [the Bronx](/wiki/The_Bronx "The Bronx") (d.1986)

[Alexei Rykov](/wiki/Alexei_Rykov "Alexei Rykov") became Chairman of the [Council of People's Commissars of the Soviet Union](/wiki/Council_of_People%27s_Commissars_of_the_Soviet_Union "Council of People's Commissars of the Soviet Union"), equivalent to Prime Minister of the Soviet Union, filling the vacancy left by the death of [Lenin](/wiki/Vladimir_Lenin "Vladimir Lenin").
sources: [Duranty, Walter](/wiki/Walter_Duranty "Walter Duranty") (February 3, 1924). "Rykoff Is Elected to Succeed Lenin; Announcement Made of His Appointment as Chairman of Federal Commissars". *The New York Times*. p. 3.

content: [Felix Dzerzhinsky](/wiki/Felix_Dzerzhinsky "Felix Dzerzhinsky") became Chairman of the [Supreme Soviet of the National Economy](/wiki/Supreme_Soviet_of_the_National_Economy "Supreme Soviet of the National Economy").

The [International Ski Federation](/wiki/International_Ski_and_Snowboard_Federation "International Ski and Snowboard Federation") (FIS) was founded in [Chamonix](/wiki/Chamonix "Chamonix") in France, site of France's International Ski Week, later recognized as the [1924 Winter Olympics](/wiki/1924_Winter_Olympics "1924 Winter Olympics"), during a meeting of leaders of the skiing organizations of various nations.
sources: Allen, E. John B. (2012). "Fédération Internationale de Ski (FIS)". *Historical Dictionary of Skiing*. [Scarecrow Press](/wiki/Scarecrow_Press "Scarecrow Press"). p. 69.

content: [Woodrow Wilson](/wiki/Woodrow_Wilson "Woodrow Wilson") fell into a coma shortly before 10:30 p.m.
sources: "Latest Bulletins on Mr. Wilson". *The New York Times*. February 3, 1924. p. 1.

"WILSON IN COMA; HEART FAILING HIM— 'He May Never Reawaken,' Says Grayson as Death Closes in on Ex-President". *[Pittsburgh Gazette-Times](/wiki/Pittsburgh_Post-Gazette "Pittsburgh Post-Gazette")*. February 3, 1924. p. 3.

content: **Born:** [Elfi von Dassanowsky](/wiki/Elfi_von_Dassanowsky "Elfi von Dassanowsky"), Austrian singer, pianist and film producer; in [Vienna](/wiki/Vienna "Vienna") (d. 2007)

[Woodrow Wilson](/wiki/Woodrow_Wilson "Woodrow Wilson"), who had served as President of the United States from 1913 to 1921, died at the age of 67 in his home at 2340 S Street NW in Washington, D.C., at 11:15 in the morning.

The Soviet Union welcomed Britain's diplomatic recognition of the USSR as an "historic step" and pledged to "make every effort to settle all misunderstandings and develop and consolidate economic relations."
sources: Williams, Paul (February 4, 1924). "Russia Accepts Britain's Offer of Recognition". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 16.

content: Germany and Turkey signed a Treaty of Friendship.
sources: ["Chronology 1924"](https://web.archive.org/web/20200402163020/http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1924.htm). *[indiana.edu](/wiki/Indiana.edu "Indiana.edu")*. 2002. Archived from [the original](http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1924.htm) on April 2, 2020. Retrieved January 16, 2015.

content: [Astra Club](/wiki/Astra_Club "Astra Club"), based in [Tokyo](/wiki/Tokyo "Tokyo"), defeated Shukyu-Dan of [Nagoya](/wiki/Nagoya "Nagoya"), 2 to 1, to [win](/wiki/1923_Emperor%27s_Cup_final "1923 Emperor's Cup final") the [Emperor's Cup](/wiki/Emperor%27s_Cup "Emperor's Cup") in football.

A flash flood inside an underground iron mine [drowned 41 of the 46 miners inside](/wiki/Milford_Mine "Milford Mine"), after the crew conducted blasting too close to the bottom of Foley Lake near [Crosby, Minnesota](/wiki/Crosby,_Minnesota "Crosby, Minnesota").
sources: "U.S. Mine Disaster— Roof Caves In And 42 Men Drowned". *[Evening Despatch](/wiki/Birmingham_Mail#Background "Birmingham Mail")*. [Birmingham](/wiki/Birmingham "Birmingham"), England. 6 February 1924. p. 1.
"Lake Bottom Drops Into Mine, Drowning 42 At Work in Iron Ore Pits Near Crosby, Minn". *The New York Times*. February 6, 1924. p. 1.

content: At 17:30:00 UTC, the [Greenwich Observatory](/wiki/Royal_Observatory,_Greenwich "Royal Observatory, Greenwich") in England, near [London](/wiki/London "London"), began its service of broadcasting regular of broadcasting a [time signal](/wiki/Time_signal "Time signal") for the standard of the exact time of day by hour, minute and second as measured at Greenwich. According to a press release from Greenwich, "the last four seconds of the preceding minute will be heard as 'clicks' when the signal is about to be given, representing the 55th, 56th, 57th, 58th and 59th second, and the final click, which will be a little louder than the others" every minute on [shortwave radio](/wiki/Shortwave_radio "Shortwave radio") to be heard worldwide, with an announcement of the exact time.
sources: Street, Sean Sean (2015). "Greenwich Time Signal". *Historical Dictionary of British Radio*. Scarecrow Press. p. 156.
"Greenwich Time by Wireless— New Scheme Today". *[Liverpool Daily Post](/wiki/Liverpool_Daily_Post "Liverpool Daily Post")*. February 5, 1924. p. 6.

content: The [Winter Olympics](/wiki/1924_Winter_Olympics "1924 Winter Olympics") closed in [Chamonix, France](/wiki/Chamonix,_France "Chamonix, France"). Norway and Finland tied for the [most gold medals](/wiki/1924_Winter_Olympics_medal_table "1924 Winter Olympics medal table") with four each, but Norway won 17 total medals to Finland's 11.

Mexican rebels retreated from their former stronghold of [Veracruz](/wiki/Veracruz "Veracruz") when federal troops won a crucial victory at [Córdoba](/wiki/C%C3%B3rdoba,_Veracruz "Córdoba, Veracruz").
sources: "Mexican Rebel Forces Beaten; Quit Vera Cruz". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 6, 1924. p. 1.

content: *The Show-Off*, a play by American playwright [George Kelly](/wiki/George_Kelly_(playwright) "George Kelly (playwright)"), opened on [Broadway](/wiki/Broadway_theatre "Broadway theatre") at the [Playhouse Theatre](/wiki/Playhouse_Theatre_(New_York_City) "Playhouse Theatre (New York City)") for the first of 571 performances.
sources: [Hirsch, Foster](/wiki/Foster_Hirsch "Foster Hirsch") (1975). *George Kelly*. Twayne Publishing. p. 29.

content: The funeral of former U.S. President [Woodrow Wilson](/wiki/Woodrow_Wilson "Woodrow Wilson") was conducted. He was buried in a vault beneath the center aisle of the chapel of the [Washington National Cathedral](/wiki/Washington_National_Cathedral "Washington National Cathedral"), becoming the first, and only, U.S. president to be buried in the District of Columbia.
sources: [Bennett, James O'Donnell](/wiki/James_O%27Donnell_Bennett "James O'Donnell Bennett") (February 7, 1924). "Wilson Sleeps in Cathedral Tomb; Notables of Nation Pay Last Homage". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 1.

content: Demonstrators raised disturbances outside the German embassy in Washington. About 200 taxi drivers walked onto the embassy lawn, and after planting the American flag, saluted it amid cheers and pistol shots. The controversy arose after the German Embassy had refused to offer condolences or to lower flags in honor of the late President Wilson, who had led the U.S. against the German Empire during World War One from 1917 to 1918.
sources: "Cab Drivers and Students 'Flag' Embassy". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 7, 1924. p. 1.
"Flag at German Embassy Joins Mourning Group". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 6, 1924. p. 1.

content: **Born:** [Sir John Richardson](/wiki/John_Richardson_(art_historian) "John Richardson (art historian)"), British art historian, in [London](/wiki/London "London") (d. 2019)

**Died:**
	* [Sir John Stewart, 1st Baronet, of Fingask](/wiki/Sir_John_Stewart,_1st_Baronet,_of_Fingask "Sir John Stewart, 1st Baronet, of Fingask"), 46, Scottish whisky distiller, committed suicide at his home at [Fingask Castle](/wiki/Fingask_Castle "Fingask Castle") in [Perthshire](/wiki/Perthshire "Perthshire").
	* [Queenie Scott-Hopper](/wiki/Queenie_Scott-Hopper "Queenie Scott-Hopper"), 42, English children's author, committed suicide at her home in Whitley Bay, by slitting her own throat. Her suicide noted stated that she took her life because she was unable "to think up any new ideas for stories."
sources: "Obituary: Sir John H. Stewart". *The Daily Telegraph*. London. February 8, 1924. p. 13.

"Authoress's Tragic End; Whitley Bay Lady Found at Her Home with Her Throat Cut". *[Newcastle Daily Chronicle](/wiki/Newcastle_Daily_Chronicle "Newcastle Daily Chronicle")*. February 7, 1924. p. 1. The deceased lady was 42 years of age.

"Writer Takes Life When Muse Is Silent— Queenie Scott-Hopper Commits Suicide Over Lack of 'New Ideas'". *[Baltimore Evening Sun](/wiki/Baltimore_Evening_Sun "Baltimore Evening Sun")*. February 8, 1924. p. 1.

content: Mexican rebel leader [Adolfo de la Huerta](/wiki/Adolfo_de_la_Huerta "Adolfo de la Huerta") and his staff withdrew by boat to [Mérida, Yucatán](/wiki/M%C3%A9rida,_Yucat%C3%A1n "Mérida, Yucatán") after federal troops recaptured the key city of [Veracruz](/wiki/Veracruz_(city) "Veracruz (city)").
sources: "Mexican Rebel Chief and Staff Reach Yucatán". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 8, 1924. p. 2.

content: The Fascist government of Italy gave formal recognition of the Communist Soviet Union.

The first [execution by lethal gas](/wiki/Gas_chamber "Gas chamber") in American history was carried out in [Carson City, Nevada](/wiki/Carson_City,_Nevada "Carson City, Nevada") at the [Nevada State Prison](/wiki/Nevada_State_Prison "Nevada State Prison"). Chinese national [Gee Jon](/wiki/Gee_Jon "Gee Jon"), convicted of a gangland slaying, was put to death with a chemical reaction that put [prussic acid](/wiki/Hydrogen_cyanide "Hydrogen cyanide") into an airtight chamber.
sources: ["Feb 8, 1924: First execution by lethal gas"](http://www.history.com/this-day-in-history/first-execution-by-lethal-gas). *This Day in History*. [History](/wiki/History_(U.S._TV_channel) "History (U.S. TV channel)"). Retrieved January 16, 2015.

content: On the same day, the U.S. state of Texas executed five prisoners— all African-American inmates who had been convicted of murder— at the [state penitentiary](/wiki/Huntsville_Unit "Huntsville Unit") in [Huntsville, Texas](/wiki/Huntsville,_Texas "Huntsville, Texas"), in the state's first use of the [electric chair](/wiki/Electric_chair "Electric chair"). Starting at 12:09 a.m., Charles Reynolds was the first to die "as Warden Walter Monroe Miller threw the switch which sent 2,500 volts and 11 amperes of electricity into Reynolds's body. Over the next hour, E. L. Morris, George Washington and Mack Matthews were put to death. The fifth inmate, Melvin Johnson, was electrocuted after a one-hour stay of execution.

The [Nakhchivan Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic](/wiki/Nakhchivan_Autonomous_Soviet_Socialist_Republic "Nakhchivan Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic") was created by the Soviet Union within the Azerbaijan Soviet Socialist Republic. On January 20, 1990, it would become the first part of the Soviet Union to secede.

U.S. President [Calvin Coolidge](/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge "Calvin Coolidge") signed a resolution ordering the [Doheny](/wiki/Edward_L._Doheny "Edward L. Doheny") and [Sinclair](/wiki/Harry_Ford_Sinclair "Harry Ford Sinclair") petroleum leases to be nullified due to the [Teapot Dome scandal](/wiki/Teapot_Dome_scandal "Teapot Dome scandal").
sources: Henning, Arthur Sears (February 9, 1924). "Coolidge Signs Revocation of Big Oil Leases". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 1.

**Died:**

[Annie Arniel](/wiki/Annie_Arniel "Annie Arniel"), 50, American suffragist and women's rights activist died by suicide from natural gas in a rooming house where she was living in [Wilmington, Delaware](/wiki/Wilmington,_Delaware "Wilmington, Delaware").

[David Dunnels White](/wiki/David_Dunnels_White "David Dunnels White"), 79, Union Army veteran of the American Civil War who would be nominated (and declined) for the [Medal of Honor](/wiki/Medal_of_Honor "Medal of Honor") in 2016.

[Madame Sorgue](/wiki/Madame_Sorgue "Madame Sorgue") (Antoinette Cauvin), 59, French anarchist, feminist and labor activist referred to as "the most dangerous woman in Europe", died of a heart attack.

The [Nakhchivan Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic](/wiki/Nakhchivan_Autonomous_Soviet_Socialist_Republic "Nakhchivan Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic") was established.[*[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")*]

As the [Drenica-Dukagjin Uprisings](/wiki/Drenica-Dukagjin_Uprisings "Drenica-Dukagjin Uprisings") drew to a close in [Kosovo](/wiki/Kosovo "Kosovo"), Yugoslavian troops carried out the massacre of 25 Albanian-minority civilians (including eight young children and ten women) in the Kosovan town of [Dubnica](/wiki/Dumnic%C3%AB_e_Poshtme,_Podujevo "Dumnicë e Poshtme, Podujevo"), then set fire to the town.
sources: Elsie, Robert. ["The Situation of the Albanian Minority in Yugoslavia Memorandum Presented to the League of Nations"](http://www.albanianhistory.net/1930_Bisaku-Kurti-Gashi/index.html). *albanianhistory.net*.

content: Mexican federal troops won a decisive battle over the rebels at [Ocotlán](/wiki/Ocotl%C3%A1n,_Jalisco "Ocotlán, Jalisco").
sources: "Obregon Wins in Big Battle Against Rebels". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 11, 1924. p. 1.

[Randy Van Horne](/wiki/Randy_Van_Horne "Randy Van Horne"), American singer and bandleader known for organizing the Randy Van Horne singers heard singing the theme songs for *The Flintstones*, *The Jetsons*, and other Hanna-Barbera cartoons; in [El Paso, Texas](/wiki/El_Paso,_Texas "El Paso, Texas") (d.2007)
[Carlos Gonzaga](/wiki/Carlos_Gonzaga "Carlos Gonzaga"), Brazilian singer; in [Paraisópolis](/wiki/Parais%C3%B3polis "Paraisópolis"), [Minas Gerais](/wiki/Minas_Gerais "Minas Gerais") state (d. 2023)
[Max Ferguson](/wiki/Max_Ferguson "Max Ferguson"), English-born Canadian radio show host for the CBC; in [Crook, County Durham](/wiki/Crook,_County_Durham "Crook, County Durham") (d. 2013)
**Died:** [Alfred Verhaeren](/wiki/Alfred_Verhaeren "Alfred Verhaeren"), 83, Belgian painter

The [United States Senate](/wiki/United_States_Senate "United States Senate") voted, 47 to 34, to demand that President [Coolidge](/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge "Calvin Coolidge") remove [Edwin Denby](/wiki/Edwin_Denby_(politician) "Edwin Denby (politician)"), who was under investigation for the [Teapot Dome scandal](/wiki/Teapot_Dome_scandal "Teapot Dome scandal"), as [Secretary of the Navy](/wiki/United_States_Secretary_of_the_Navy "United States Secretary of the Navy"). Coolidge said in a statement that evening that, "As soon as special counsel can advise me as to the legality of these leases and assemble for me the pertinent facts in the various transactions, I shall take such action as seems essential for the full protection of the public interests".
sources: Henning, Arthur Sears (February 12, 1924). "Senate Defied by President". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 1.

content: The five-day [Negro Sanhedrin](/wiki/Negro_Sanhedrin "Negro Sanhedrin") opened in Chicago with 250 delegates from trade unions, civic groups and fraternal organizations in an attempt to create a program to protect the legal rights of African-American tenant farmers.

The Greek government deposited the instrument of ratification of the [treaty of Lausanne](/wiki/Treaty_of_Lausanne "Treaty of Lausanne"),  the peace treaty between Turkey and the Allied Powers, that was concluded on July 24, 1923.

**Born:** [Edward "Budge" Patty](/wiki/Budge_Patty "Budge Patty"), U.S. tennis player who won the French Open and Wimbledon in 1950, later inducted to the [International Tennis Hall of Fame](/wiki/International_Tennis_Hall_of_Fame "International Tennis Hall of Fame"); in [Fort Smith, Arkansas](/wiki/Fort_Smith,_Arkansas "Fort Smith, Arkansas") (d. 2021)
**Died:** [Jean-François Raffaëlli](/wiki/Jean-Fran%C3%A7ois_Raffa%C3%ABlli "Jean-François Raffaëlli"), 74, French painter, sculptor and printmaker

[Howard Carter](/wiki/Howard_Carter "Howard Carter") and his archaeological team had the lid of Pharaoh [Tutankhamun](/wiki/Tutankhamun "Tutankhamun")'s stone sarcophagus raised, revealing his solid gold mummy case. The case itself would not be opened until October 28, 1925.
sources: "Mummy Case of Tut Built of Solid Gold". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 13, 1924. p. 1.

content: The [George Gershwin](/wiki/George_Gershwin "George Gershwin") musical composition *[Rhapsody in Blue](/wiki/Rhapsody_in_Blue "Rhapsody in Blue")* premiered at the [Aeolian Hall](/wiki/Aeolian_Hall_(Manhattan) "Aeolian Hall (Manhattan)") in New York City.
sources: ["Feb 12, 1924: Rhapsody In Blue, by George Gershwin, performed for first time"](http://www.history.com/this-day-in-history/rhapsody-in-blue-by-george-gershwin-performed-for-first-time). *This Day in History*. [History](/wiki/History_(U.S._TV_channel) "History (U.S. TV channel)"). Retrieved January 16, 2015.

content: The play *[Beggar on Horseback](/wiki/Beggar_on_Horseback "Beggar on Horseback")*, by [George S. Kaufman](/wiki/George_S._Kaufman "George S. Kaufman") and [Marc Connelly](/wiki/Marc_Connelly "Marc Connelly"), opened on Broadway.[*[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")*]

*[L'Unita](/wiki/L%27Unita "L'Unita")* began a 67-year run as the official newspaper of the Italian Communist Party, before becoming an independent leftist periodical after the dissolution of the PCI. The paper would cease publication entirely in 2017.
sources: Anna Momigliano (16 September 2008). ["In Italy, Female Editor Signals Women's Rise"](https://www.csmonitor.com/World/Europe/2008/0916/p07s02-woeu.html). *The Christian Science Monitor*.

**Died:** [Ernest Joy](/wiki/Ernest_Joy "Ernest Joy"), 46, American stage actor
sources: ["Ernest Joy - Broadway Cast & Staff"](https://www.ibdb.com/broadway-cast-staff/ernest-joy-47267). *[Internet Broadway Database](/wiki/Internet_Broadway_Database "Internet Broadway Database")*. [The Broadway League](/wiki/The_Broadway_League "The Broadway League"). Retrieved 14 September 2023.

content: German nationalists attacked the headquarters of Rhineland separatists in [Pirmasens](/wiki/Pirmasens "Pirmasens"), smashing their way into the building and setting it ablaze, while snipers outside shot at the separatists. The fighting and the blaze killed 36 people, most of them separatists, an elderly woman bystander was killed by a stray bullet.
sources: Skene, Don (February 14, 1924). "Cheer Massacare of Rhine Rebels". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 1.

content: The first [fascist](/wiki/Fascism "Fascism") event ever held in public in the United Kingdom took place at the [Hotel Cecil](/wiki/Hotel_Cecil_(London) "Hotel Cecil (London)") in London, as about 500 members of the [British Fascisti](/wiki/British_Fascists "British Fascists") and Italian expatriates attended.
sources: "British Fascism Forms to Avert Labor Dictator". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 14, 1924. p. 5.

content: The day after testifying in the trial of Shoeless Joe Jackson, former Chicago White Sox outfielder [Oscar "Happy" Felsch](/wiki/Happy_Felsch "Happy Felsch") was arrested for [perjury](/wiki/Perjury "Perjury") in testimony given as a rebuttal witness for Jackson. The arrest came after lawyers for the Chicago White Sox produced letters that contradicted Felsch's statements. Felsch posted his own $2,000 bail and was released.
sources: "Arrest Felsch for Perjury in Jackson Case". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 14, 1924. p. 11.
"Felsch Spills Jackson Beans; Helps Comiskey". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 13, 1924. p. 27.

content: [Howard Carter](/wiki/Howard_Carter "Howard Carter") abruptly suspended work on Tutankhamun's tomb and had it resealed, "owing to the impossible restrictions and discourtesies on the part of the public works department and its antiquity section." The dispute was reportedly about media access rights.
sources: "Carter Leaves Tut to his Fate in Gilded Tomb". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 14, 1924. p. 3.

content: The [Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company](/wiki/Computing-Tabulating-Recording_Company "Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company") (CTR) renamed itself the International Business Machines Corporation, or [IBM](/wiki/IBM "IBM").
sources: ["Chronological History of IBM: 1920s"](https://www-03.ibm.com/ibm/history/history/decade_1920.html). *[IBM](/wiki/IBM "IBM")*. 23 January 2003. Retrieved January 16, 2015.

content: Mexican federal troops inflicted another defeat on rebels near Paloverde southwest of [Pénjamo](/wiki/P%C3%A9njamo "Pénjamo").
sources: "Swift Escobar Crushed Mexico Rebels in West". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 15, 1924. p. 1.

content: The planned city of [Longview, Washington](/wiki/Longview,_Washington "Longview, Washington"), was incorporated after being designed by city planner [George Kessler](/wiki/George_Kessler "George Kessler") for the [Long-Bell Lumber Company](/wiki/Long-Bell_Lumber_Company "Long-Bell Lumber Company") to house 11,000 residents who were employees and their families.

Part 1 of the [Fritz Lang](/wiki/Fritz_Lang "Fritz Lang") fantasy film *[Die Nibelungen](/wiki/Die_Nibelungen "Die Nibelungen")* premiered at the [Ufa-Palast am Zoo](/wiki/Ufa-Palast_am_Zoo "Ufa-Palast am Zoo") in Berlin.
sources: ["UFA Film Nights: Die Nibelungen – Siegfried"](http://www.visitberlin.de/en/event/08-15-2013/ufa-film-nights-die-nibelungen-siegfried). *Visit Berlin*. Retrieved January 16, 2015.

content: **Born:** [Juan Ponce Enrile](/wiki/Juan_Ponce_Enrile "Juan Ponce Enrile"), Philippine politician who served as Minister of National Defense for President Ferdinand Marcos from 1970 to 1986, President of the Philippine Senate from 2008 to 2013, and, at the age of 98, became the Chief Presidential Legal Counsel for President [Ferdinand Marcos Jr.](/wiki/Bongbong_Marcos "Bongbong Marcos") in 2022; in [Gonzaga, Cagayan](/wiki/Gonzaga,_Cagayan "Gonzaga, Cagayan") (living in 2024)

U.S. troops began their intervention in the [civil war in Honduras](/wiki/Second_Honduran_Civil_War "Second Honduran Civil War"), with 167 U.S. Marines and nine officers landing at [Ampala](/wiki/Ampala "Ampala") after being brought by the battle cruiser [USS *Milwaukee*](/wiki/USS_Milwaukee_(CL-5) "USS Milwaukee (CL-5)").

U.S. Senator [Frank L. Greene](/wiki/Frank_L._Greene "Frank L. Greene") of Vermont was seriously wounded when he was shot in the head by a stray bullet during a shootout between [Prohibition](/wiki/Prohibition "Prohibition") enforcement agents and [bootleggers](/wiki/Rum-running "Rum-running"). Senator Greene had been walking along Washington's [Pennsylvania Avenue](/wiki/Pennsylvania_Avenue "Pennsylvania Avenue") with his wife and was left partially paralyzed.
sources: "Senator Shot by Dry Sleuth". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 16, 1924. p. 1.

content: The jury in the [Joe Jackson](/wiki/Shoeless_Joe_Jackson "Shoeless Joe Jackson")-White Sox case awarded Jackson over $16,000 in unpaid salary. However, Judge Gregory declared that the plaintiff's case was based on perjury and declared a mistrial. Jackson was triumphant at the verdict despite it being set aside.
sources: "Jury Finds for Jackson; Judge "Kills" Verdict". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 16, 1924. p. 13.
Curran, Dan (April 23, 2010). ["The Milwaukee trial of Shoeless Joe Jackson"](http://onmilwaukee.com/sports/articles/shoelessjoetrialmilwaukee.html). *On Milwaukee*. Retrieved January 16, 2015.

content: In Germany, the enabling act of December 8 expired under its own terms, after having allowed Chancellor [Wilhelm Marx](/wiki/Wilhelm_Marx "Wilhelm Marx") and [his cabinet](/wiki/First_Marx_cabinet "First Marx cabinet") to issue emergency decrees. In the first session of the Reichstag afterward, legislators began the process of attempting to repeal the Marx cabinet decrees.

**Born:** [Helmut Oberlander](/wiki/Helmut_Oberlander "Helmut Oberlander"), Nazi war criminal who was part of the *[Einsatzgruppen](/wiki/Einsatzgruppen "Einsatzgruppen")* death squad of the SS during World War II, who immigrated to Canada in 1954; at [Halbstadt](/wiki/Molotschna "Molotschna"), [Ukrainian SSR](/wiki/Ukrainian_SSR "Ukrainian SSR"), [Soviet Union](/wiki/Soviet_Union "Soviet Union") (now Molotschna, Ukraine) (d.2021)
**Died:** [Lionel Monckton](/wiki/Lionel_Monckton "Lionel Monckton"), 62, English composer for [stage musicals](/wiki/Musical_theatre "Musical theatre")
Nearly 200,000 British dock workers went on strike.
sources: Williams, Paul (February 17, 1924). "Britain Facing Food Rationing as Dockers Strike". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 3.

content: German artist [George Grosz](/wiki/George_Grosz "George Grosz") was fined 500 gold marks (6,000 marks) when a collection of his drawings depicting the decadence of Berlin society was ruled obscene by the court.
sources: Philip, Neil (November 25, 2010). ["Port d'eaux-mortes – George Grosz in France"](http://adventuresintheprinttrade.blogspot.ca/2010/11/port-deaux-mortes-george-grosz-in.html). *Adventures in the Print Trade*. Retrieved January 16, 2015.

["Kunstwerk des Monats Juni"](http://www.smkp.de/sammlungen/kunstwerk-des-monats/2014/juni-2014.html). *[Museum Kunstpalast](/wiki/Museum_Kunstpalast "Museum Kunstpalast")*. 2014. Retrieved January 16, 2015.

A [referendum on employment protection](/wiki/1924_Swiss_employment_protection_referendum "1924 Swiss employment protection referendum") was held in Switzerland. Voters rejected a proposed amendment to the federal employment protection law.

The Western film *[The Night Hawk](/wiki/The_Night_Hawk_(1924_film) "The Night Hawk (1924 film)")* starring [Harry Carey](/wiki/Harry_Carey_(actor) "Harry Carey (actor)") was released.[*[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")*]

[Herma Szabo](/wiki/Herma_Szabo "Herma Szabo") of Austria won the women's competition of the [World Figure Skating Championships](/wiki/1924_World_Figure_Skating_Championships "1924 World Figure Skating Championships") held in [Oslo](/wiki/Oslo "Oslo"), Norway.[*[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")*]

A series of explosions at the W. P. Gilbert [trench warfare](/wiki/Trench_warfare "Trench warfare") [filling factory](/wiki/Filling_factories_in_the_United_Kingdom "Filling factories in the United Kingdom") killed 12 young women and a male foreman who were employees in south east London at the borough of [Slade Green](/wiki/Slade_Green "Slade Green"), near [Dartford](/wiki/Dartford "Dartford").

The popular U.S. comic strip *[Boots and Her Buddies](/wiki/Boots_and_Her_Buddies "Boots and Her Buddies")*, by [Edgar Martin](/wiki/Edgar_Martin "Edgar Martin"), was published for the first time and would run for 44 years until ending on October 6, 1968.
sources: Reynolds, Moira Davison (2 October 2015). [*Comic Strip Artists in American Newspapers, 1945-1980*](https://books.google.com/books?id=m5G4yNh2B-AC&dq=%22boots+and+her+buddies%22&pg=PA58). McFarland. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [9780786481507](/wiki/Special:BookSources/9780786481507 "Special:BookSources/9780786481507"). Retrieved 17 December 2021 – via Google Books.

content: American jazz cornet player and composer [Bix Beiderbecke](/wiki/Bix_Beiderbecke "Bix Beiderbecke") (Leon Bismark Beiderbecke) made his recording debut as he and his band [The Wolverines](/wiki/The_Wolverines_(jazz_band) "The Wolverines (jazz band)") created the 78 rpm record "[Fidgety Feet](/wiki/Fidgety_Feet "Fidgety Feet")" for Gennett Studios, with "Jazz Me Blues" on the opposite side.
sources: Hoffman, Frank (2004). [*Encyclopedia of Recorded Sound*](https://books.google.com/books?id=-FOSAgAAQBAJ&pg=PA1070). Routledge. p. 1070. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [9781135949501](/wiki/Special:BookSources/9781135949501 "Special:BookSources/9781135949501").

content: British Prime Minister [Ramsay MacDonald](/wiki/Ramsay_MacDonald "Ramsay MacDonald") warned against [profiteers](/wiki/Profiteering_(business) "Profiteering (business)") extracting "unjust prices" during the dock worker's strike.
sources: Williams, Paul (February 19, 1924). "Labor Cabinet Fights British Docker Strike". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 1.

content: The cost of a four-pound loaf of bread went up a [halfpenny](/wiki/Halfpenny_(British_pre-decimal_coin) "Halfpenny (British pre-decimal coin)") to eightpence-halfpenny as a result of the dock strike.

	* [Harold Finger](/wiki/Harold_Finger "Harold Finger"), American aeronautical nuclear engineer director of the [Space Nuclear Propulsion Office](/wiki/Space_Nuclear_Propulsion_Office "Space Nuclear Propulsion Office"); in [Brooklyn, New York](/wiki/Brooklyn,_New_York "Brooklyn, New York") (alive in 2024)

**Died:** [Victor Capoul](/wiki/Victor_Capoul "Victor Capoul"), 83, French operatic tenor

After less than four weeks in office, [Eleftherios Venizelos](/wiki/Eleftherios_Venizelos "Eleftherios Venizelos") resigned as [Prime Minister of Greece](/wiki/List_of_prime_ministers_of_Greece "List of prime ministers of Greece") because of bad health and was succeeded by Agriculture Minister [Georgios Kafantaris](/wiki/Georgios_Kafantaris "Georgios Kafantaris").

An initial outline of the [Dawes](/wiki/Charles_G._Dawes "Charles G. Dawes") committee's financial plan was presented to French Prime Minister [Raymond Poincaré](/wiki/Raymond_Poincar%C3%A9 "Raymond Poincaré") in Paris.
sources: Wales, Henry (February 20, 1924). "France Bows to Dawes Experts on Ruhr Control". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 5.

content: **Born:** [Lee Marvin](/wiki/Lee_Marvin "Lee Marvin") (Lamont Walton Marvin Jr), American film and television actor, winner of the 1965 Academy Award for Best Actor for *[Cat Ballou](/wiki/Cat_Ballou "Cat Ballou")*; in New York City (d. 1987)

The [Volga German Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic](/wiki/Volga_German_Autonomous_Soviet_Socialist_Republic "Volga German Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic") was set up for the [ethnic German](/wiki/Russia_Germans "Russia Germans") minority in the Soviet Union, with a capital city of Kosakenstadt, now [Engels](/wiki/Engels,_Saratov_Oblast "Engels, Saratov Oblast") in the [Saratov Oblast](/wiki/Saratov_Oblast "Saratov Oblast"). It would exist until its abolition by the USSR on September 7, 1941 in response to the invasion by Nazi Germany.

French military leaders objected to a clause in the Dawes proposal that would return the railroads in the [occupied Ruhr](/wiki/Occupation_of_the_Ruhr "Occupation of the Ruhr") region to German control.
sources: "Dawes Plan for Ruhr is Opposed by French Army". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 21, 1924. p. 6.

[Lis Mellemgaard](/wiki/Lis_Mellemgaard "Lis Mellemgaard"), 95, Danish spy for the [Holger Danske](/wiki/Holger_Danske_(resistance_group) "Holger Danske (resistance group)") resistance group during World War II; in [Copenhagen](/wiki/Copenhagen "Copenhagen") (d.2019)

**Died:** [Louis Péringuey](/wiki/Louis_P%C3%A9ringuey "Louis Péringuey"), 68, South African entomologist who specialized in insects and reptiles and was director of the [South African Museum](/wiki/South_African_Museum "South African Museum") in [Cape Town](/wiki/Cape_Town "Cape Town"). The genus *[Peringueyella](/wiki/Peringueyella "Peringueyella")* of [katydids](/wiki/Tettigoniidae "Tettigoniidae") is named in his honor, as are the reptile species [Peringuey's leaf-toed gecko](/wiki/Peringuey%27s_leaf-toed_gecko "Peringuey's leaf-toed gecko") (*Cryptactites peringueyi*) and [Peringuey's adder](/wiki/Peringuey%27s_adder "Peringuey's adder") (*Bitis peringueyi*) and the black cocktail ant (*[Crematogaster peringueyi](/wiki/Crematogaster_peringueyi "Crematogaster peringueyi")*).

British dock workers rejected the terms offered to them for a settlement of the strike. Their employers had offered them an immediate 1 shilling-per-day raise with another shilling to be added June 1.
sources: Williams, Paul (February 22, 1924). "Dockers' Strike Flames Anew on Radical Fuel". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 7.

content: The Republic of Austria gave formal recognition to the Soviet Union and opened diplomatic relations.
sources: "Austria Gives Recognition to Soviet Regime". *[Los Angeles Times](/wiki/Los_Angeles_Times "Los Angeles Times")*. February 22, 1924. p. 10.

content: The [D. W. Griffith](/wiki/D._W._Griffith "D. W. Griffith")-directed film *[America](/wiki/America_(1924_film) "America (1924 film)")* premiered at the [44th Street Theatre](/wiki/44th_Street_Theatre "44th Street Theatre") in New York City.
sources: Holston, Kim R. (2013). *Movie Roadshows: A History and Filmography of Reserved-Seat Limited Showings, 1911–1973*. Jefferson, North Carolina: McFarland & Company, Inc. p. 35. [Calvin Coolidge](/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge "Calvin Coolidge") became the first President to make a radio broadcast from the [White House](/wiki/White_House "White House") when he gave a national address on the occasion of [George Washington](/wiki/George_Washington "George Washington")'s birthday.
sources: ["Other "Firsts""](http://www.oldradio.com/current/bc_1sts.htm). *The Broadcast Archive*. February 17, 2013. Retrieved January 16, 2015.
"Washington Is Still Our Guide, Coolidge Avers; Holiday Speech Goes Out on Radio Waves". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 23, 1924. p. 5.

content: The [Treaty of Rome](/wiki/Treaty_of_Rome_(1924) "Treaty of Rome (1924)") signed on January 27 between the [Kingdom of Italy](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Italy "Kingdom of Italy") and the [Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Serbs,_Croats_and_Slovenes "Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes") took effect after being ratified by representatives of both parties, dissolving the [Free State of Fiume](/wiki/Free_State_of_Fiume "Free State of Fiume") and dividing it between the two kingdoms.

A bill to provide for automatic U.S. citizenship for Native American peoples was introduced by U.S. Representative [Homer P. Snyder](/wiki/Homer_P._Snyder "Homer P. Snyder"), a Republican for the state of New York.[*[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")*] The text of the [Indian Citizenship Act](/wiki/Indian_Citizenship_Act "Indian Citizenship Act") stated "*Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,*, That all non citizen Indians born within the territorial limits of the United States be, and they are hereby, declared to be citizens of the United States: *Provided* That the granting of such citizenship shall not in any manner impair or otherwise affect the right of any Indian to tribal or other property."

**Born:**
	* [Jack Pierce](/wiki/Jack_Pierce_(oilman) "Jack Pierce (oilman)"), Canadian oil executive and Chairman of [Ranger Oil](/wiki/Ranger_Oil "Ranger Oil") and a leader of the 1974 discovery of the 1.2 billion barrel Ninian Oil Field in the North Sea; in [Westmount, Quebec](/wiki/Westmount,_Quebec "Westmount, Quebec") (d.1991)
	* [Vincent Marotta](/wiki/Vincent_Marotta "Vincent Marotta"), American inventor who (with Samuel Glazer), invented the first automatic drip coffee maker, marketed as "[Mr. Coffee](/wiki/Mr._Coffee "Mr. Coffee")"; in [Cleveland](/wiki/Cleveland "Cleveland") (d.2015)

[Jack Pierce](/wiki/Jack_Pierce_(oilman) "Jack Pierce (oilman)"), Canadian oil executive and Chairman of [Ranger Oil](/wiki/Ranger_Oil "Ranger Oil") and a leader of the 1974 discovery of the 1.2 billion barrel Ninian Oil Field in the North Sea; in [Westmount, Quebec](/wiki/Westmount,_Quebec "Westmount, Quebec") (d.1991)

[Vincent Marotta](/wiki/Vincent_Marotta "Vincent Marotta"), American inventor who (with Samuel Glazer), invented the first automatic drip coffee maker, marketed as "[Mr. Coffee](/wiki/Mr._Coffee "Mr. Coffee")"; in [Cleveland](/wiki/Cleveland "Cleveland") (d.2015)

Designed by [Henry Berliner](/wiki/Henry_Berliner "Henry Berliner") and his father [Emile Berliner](/wiki/Emile_Berliner "Emile Berliner"), the [Berliner gyrocopter](/wiki/Berliner_Helicopter "Berliner Helicopter") Model No. 5, capable of flying at a speed of 40 miles per hour (64 km/h), to hover at an altitude of 15 feet (4.6 m), and to turn within a radius of 15 feet (4.6 m), was given its first successful demonstration. U.S. Army Lieutenant Harold R. Harris flew the machine for 1 minute and 20 seconds at [College Park Airport](/wiki/College_Park_Airport "College Park Airport") near the [University of Maryland](/wiki/University_of_Maryland "University of Maryland"), in front of U.S. Navy officials and members of the press.
Mexican federal troops defeated rebels in a battle fought in an oil region in the state of [Tamaulipas](/wiki/Tamaulipas "Tamaulipas").
sources: Cornyn, John (February 25, 1924). "Obregon Troops Rout Rebels at "Cave of Devil"". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 4.

content: The [Beverly Hills Speedway](/wiki/Beverly_Hills_Speedway "Beverly Hills Speedway") hosted its final race, attended by 85,000. The track was torn down afterward because the rapidly increasing real estate values had rendered the track an uneconomical use of property. [Harlan Fengler](/wiki/Harlan_Fengler "Harlan Fengler") broke the world record for a 250-mile race, averaging 116.6 miles per hour (187.6 km/h).
sources: Rasmussen, Cecilia (October 19, 1992). ["L.A. Scene – The City – Then and Now"](http://articles.latimes.com/1992-10-19/local/me-529_1_american-racing). *Los Angeles Times*. Retrieved January 16, 2015.

content: British dock workers voted to accept the offer of their employers to receive a rise of 1 shilling-per-day plus an additional shilling on June 1.
sources: "British Dockers Vote to Accept Offer of Bosses". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 25, 1924. p. 4.

content: **Born:** [Ted Arison](/wiki/Ted_Arison "Ted Arison"), Israeli businessman who was the founder of [Carnival Cruise Lines](/wiki/Carnival_Cruise_Lines "Carnival Cruise Lines") after being the co-founder of [Norwegian Cruise Lines](/wiki/Norwegian_Cruise_Lines "Norwegian Cruise Lines"); in [Tel Aviv](/wiki/Tel_Aviv "Tel Aviv"), [British Mandate for Palestine](/wiki/Mandatory_Palestine "Mandatory Palestine") (d. 1999)

In the Soviet Union, the Politburo of the Soviet Communist Party began the task of [National delimitation in Central Asia](/wiki/National_delimitation_in_the_Soviet_Union#National_delimitation_in_Central_Asia "National delimitation in the Soviet Union"), setting specific boundaries for Soviet socialist republics for ethnic minorities. Among the changes was to partition the Turkestan ASSR into what are now the nations of [Turkmenistan](/wiki/Turkmenistan "Turkmenistan"), [Uzbekistan](/wiki/Uzbekistan "Uzbekistan"), and later forming [Tajikistan](/wiki/Tajikistan "Tajikistan") and [Kyrgyzstan](/wiki/Kyrgyzstan "Kyrgyzstan"), while what is now [Kazakhstan](/wiki/Kazakhstan "Kazakhstan") was set aside in 1936.
The Western film *[Ride for Your Life](/wiki/Ride_for_Your_Life "Ride for Your Life")* was released.[*[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")*]
The Cuban strike was settled.
sources: "Reach Settlement of Cuban Railway and Dock Strike". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 26, 1924. p. 1.

content: **Born:** [Kurt Amplatz](/wiki/Kurt_Amplatz "Kurt Amplatz"), Austrian radiologist and inventor of two devices to correcting [atrial septal defect](/wiki/Atrial_septal_defect "Atrial septal defect") in infants; in [Weistrach](/wiki/Weistrach "Weistrach") (d.2019)

The trial of with [Adolf Hitler](/wiki/Adolf_Hitler "Adolf Hitler"), [Erich Ludendorff](/wiki/Erich_Ludendorff "Erich Ludendorff"), and eight other Nazis for charges of treason arising from the [Beer Hall Putsch](/wiki/Beer_Hall_Putsch "Beer Hall Putsch") of November 9, 1923, began in [Munich](/wiki/Munich "Munich"). Security was heavy and onlookers were thoroughly searched for weapons before being allowed in.
sources: "Treason Trial of Ludendorff Real Friendly". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. February 27, 1924. p. 11.

[Rees, Laurence](/wiki/Laurence_Rees "Laurence Rees") (2012). *Hitler's Charisma: Leading Millions into the Abyss*. London: [Pantheon Books](/wiki/Pantheon_Books "Pantheon Books"). p. 42. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-307-37729-6](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-307-37729-6 "Special:BookSources/978-0-307-37729-6").

George Randolph Chester Yields to Heart attack in his Gotham Home"](https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=mnVhAAAAIBAJ&sjid=fv4DAAAAIBAJ&pg=3562%2C2504203). *[Toledo Blade](/wiki/Toledo_Blade "Toledo Blade")*. March 6, 1924. Retrieved 2021-10-13 – via Google News.

content: The government of Prime Minister [Georges Theunis](/wiki/Georges_Theunis "Georges Theunis") fell in Belgium over a vote on a Franco-Belgian import-export bill. The news caused the ailing [French franc](/wiki/French_franc "French franc") to immediately drop to a new low, 24.50 to the U.S. dollar.
sources: Wales, Henry (February 28, 1924). "Fall of Belgian Cabinet Halts Dawes Exports". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 14.

The [Kingdom of Yugoslavia](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Yugoslavia "Kingdom of Yugoslavia") increased its troop presence on its border with [Bulgaria](/wiki/Bulgaria "Bulgaria") across from [Pernik](/wiki/Pernik "Pernik"), in response to raids from [Macedonian](/wiki/Macedonia_(region) "Macedonia (region)") irregulars from the area.
sources: Fendrick, Raymond (February 29, 1924). "Jugo-Slavs Move Big Force for Bulgaria Group". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 5.

content: **Born:**[Christopher C. Kraft Jr.](/wiki/Christopher_C._Kraft_Jr. "Christopher C. [Erich Ludendorff](/wiki/Erich_Ludendorff "Erich Ludendorff") took the stand in his defense in the trial at Munich. He gave a long justification of the reasons for attempting the putsch, explaining, "We want a Germany free of Marxism, semitism, and papal influences."
sources: Clayton, John (March 1, 1924). ""I Fought Rule by Red or Jew" – Ludendorff". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 3.
